cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles SSW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north, then accelerating north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward Florida’s Big Bend and the southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near Cedar Key

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Englewood to the Middle of Longboat Key
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane & Storm-Surge Warning from the Middle of Longboat Key northward to Indian Pass, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast from Englewood northward through Tampa Bay to Indian Pass (Big Bend)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely; hurricane-force gusts possible Wednesday morning as the center passes just north of Tampa Bay.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC forecasts 4–7 ft of inundation in Tampa Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals up to 12 inches possible, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes Tuesday into Wednesday; dangerous surf and rip currents ahead of the storm.
